thinking.disposable_income: Northside Village has a relatively low median household income around $35,000, with many residents living below the poverty line and being cost-sensitive to transportation expenses.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Limited discretionary spending capacity with most income going to basic necessities, making residents particularly sensitive to both sales tax increases and transportation costs.
thinking.accessibility: The neighborhood has moderate transit access with several bus routes but many residents rely on personal vehicles, with about 75% of households owning cars while also having significant transit-dependent population.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized proposals with lower transit fares ($0.75) to help transit-dependent residents 2) Favored moderate sales tax (1%) to balance transit funding with household budget impacts 3) Selected moderate driving fees ($0.50) to improve transit service while not overly burdening car-dependent residents 4) Considered travel time improvements for both transit and car users 5) Ranked proposals that offer best combined benefits for mixed-mode community
